name: Signed Photo
description: Photograph or Postcard with one of my books cover (Your choice),signed by me, the author. (5X8)

options.name: (Photograph)Night Terrors: Eye of The Living Shadow COVER
(PostCard)Night Terrors: Eye of The Living Shadow

name: Dead Girl Hands: Awakening
description:
Terra Wilcox was an average teenager. She had hopes, dreams, a future. One stray bullet changed all that. 
On the 16th of October, she is caught in the path of a stray bullet, which brings an end to her short lived life. Not long after her death, her school begins to be ravaged by attacks, said to be carried out by an unseen force. 
Now Amber Bennet must find a way to help the soul of her best friend cross over and to free her of the demon that has possessed her. Before its too late. 
With the help of Mark Burdett, will true love be enough to bring back Terra from the abyss? Or will everyone she has ever loved, perish under what she has become?


(246 pgs, available in paperback.)

name: Night Terrors: Eye of The Living Shadow
description:
No dream was safe. Every Night Terror I had began to blur with reality until they were no longer separate. In the months that had passed, I was the only one to return. 
   With my death, I joined a war that lay beneath heaven and above hell, in limbo where people believed that the living were dead, and they were alive. I had put the people I loved most in danger of not only losing their lives, but their souls. Unfortunately, evil did not rest while I was away.  
   Shadows could now cross over during the day, lingering in doorway, mirrors, and no longer seek just us guardians. The deaths of mortals are escalating at an alarming rate. With Alex still missing, the race is on to find a way to open a journal the first guardian has left behind, and find a way to stop the shadows. Now, I have to face the consequences of the deals I’ve made, and meet death, for a second time.



(206 pgs, available in paperback)

name: Night Terrors: Hallways & Mirrors
description:
Kitra Reed was a teenager who lived a fairly normal life. Up until she turned sixteenth birthday that is. She would wake up in the middle of the night; a cold sweat drenching her sheets, gasping for air, her hands racing defensively to her throat. In these brief moments that followed, she would always realize two things. One: it all had been a nightmare, a terrible nightmare. And two: the three figures standing at the foot of her bed hadn’t disappeared with the scenery, they had followed her out. 
 
These figures, she knew them all too well. Two were men silhouettes and one was female. She would always be running from them in a dark, eerie familiar place. But they would always reach her, pin her down, and begin to choke the life from her. Even after she woke, the pressure around her throat was real, would linger in bruises, and those figures would still be there, staring at her. 
 
Doctors called them night terrors. They said they weren’t uncommon for children and young teenagers who had recently lost their parents. Only, these started the night of her sixteenth birthday, two weeks before their death. 
 
A little over two months later, her best friend Holly Garland goes missing. With no dreaming being safe, she soon realizes that her abduction is a case of mistaken identity, and these people were really after her. She is rescued By Guardians named Alex and Kaw when she finds Holly’s grandmother dead, unknowingly joining a war that has been waging between the original angels, and fallen angels. What she doesn’t realize is the journey to save her friend will make her a little less than human, and ultimately, may claim her life.



(206 pgs, available in paperback)

name: Minus One
description:
All of Gwen's life, she was the outcast. Always failing her classes, sneaking out of the house, she would even steal. She was in a lot of ways, the shadow image of her twin sister Aelinor. Soon, that would all change. The night of their senior prom, they both get into a terrible car crash. Aelinor was killed instantly.Or so Gwen thought... 
 
Without hesitation, Gwen takes her sisters place, and the life she always wanted; going as far as to claim her scholarship, and even her boyfriend. Seemingly, her newlife gets off to a good start. Until she starts get threatening letters demanding for her to tell the truth about Aelinor or join her. 
 
As time goes on, the letters become more threatening, and the death count of the people she and her twin grew up with, grows. How long can fool everyone she knows? How long can she deceive them into believing Gwen was the one who died, before the person who wrote the letter comes for her? Should she just come clean and go to the police? After all the car crash was an accident...right? 
 
Gwen will soon discover that beneath the bonds of twins lies a lethal jealousy, and that some secrets, refuse to stay buried...



(368 pgs, available in paperback and hardcover)
